snippet: As middle-class society deteriorates, many Greeks fear that elections on Sunday will offer no clear route out of a deepening political and economic crisis.
abstract: Athens Journal; As middle-class society deteriorates, many Greeks fear that elections on June 17 will offer no clear route out of a deepening political and economic crisis; from its wealthy northern suburbs to the concrete blocks of downtown, there is a sense of an endgame in Athens.

byline.contributor: Suzanne Daley and Dimitris Bounias contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: As middle-class society deteriorates, many Greeks fear that elections on Sunday will offer no clear route out of a deepening political and economic crisis.

headline.seo: Greeks Dread Future as Their World Deteriorates
headline.main: Dread and Uncertainty Pervade Life in a Diminished Greece
headline.print_headline: Dread and Uncertainty Pervade Life in a Diminished Greece
